name: Uncertainty Quantification in Particle Physics
description: Estimate the 68% Confidence Interval (CI) for the signal strength parameter (µ) in simulated particle physics data, addressing aleatoric and epistemic uncertainties.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Tabular dataset with 32 features describing collision events. Includes labeled training data (BaselineTrain) and unlabeled test data with randomized µtrue values and systematic distortions. Example features: 'pt', 'eta', 'phi', 'mass'.

cr:output.name: predictions
cr:output.description: Predicted 68% Confidence Interval (CI) for the signal strength parameter µ. Includes lower bound (µ16) and upper bound (µ84). Example: µ16=0.8, µ84=1.2.

field.name: mu16
field.description: Lower bound of the 68% CI for µ, e.g., 0.8

field.name: mu84
field.description: Upper bound of the 68% CI for µ, e.g., 1.2

cr:evaluation.notes: Coverage Score combines precision (interval width) and coverage (proportion of intervals containing µtruth). Under-coverage is penalized more than over-coverage.

open_questions: What is the exact format of the dataset files (e.g., CSV, HDF5)?
What are the precise column names and data types in the dataset?
What are the exact systematic distortions applied to the test data?
What is the URL or access method for the dataset?
What is the Docker image or environment specification for the competition?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper
cr:execution.allowedExternalData - external data usage policy not specified
cr:implementation.cr:environment - Docker image or exact environment specification not provided
cr:input[0].description - precise column names and data types not fully detailed
